alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lake, northwestern Orange and northwestern Volusia Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pittman, or near Paisley, moving north at 15 mph. Additional strong storms will persist across Lake County and inland Volusia County through this evening. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Apopka, DeLand, Leesburg, Eustis and Tavares. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Southern Lake County
